data_statement: Input data sets that support the current study concern the following: (i) GHG emission inventory and air pollutant emission inventory of Shenzhen in 2015, which are collected from the Ecology and Environment Bureau and Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality, respectively. There are limitations to the availability of these data because of the confidentiality agreement required by Shenzhen’s official agencies. (ii) Sector-specific energy consumption is collected from the Shenzhen Statistical Yearbook 2016 (http://tjj.sz.gov.cn/zwgk/zfxxgkml/tjsj/tjnj/content/post_3085973.html) and the Statistics Bureau of Shenzhen Municipality, with the GHG emission factor of various types of energy collected from Shenzhen’s Guidance for Verification of the Organization-level Greenhouse Gas Emissions (https://www.sist.org.cn/xwzx/tzgg/201805/t20180523_2230811.html). (iii) Sector-specific generation coefficient and removal coefficient of major air pollutants are gathered from the Environmental Science Research Institute of Shenzhen. (iv) Key parameters of Shenzhen’s socioeconomic development for the period 2016–2030 are drawn from the 13th Five-Year Development Planning of Shenzhen and the Sustainable Development Planning of Shenzhen (2017–2030), together with interviews with urban competent departments and local experts, and are available in Supporting Information Tables S2 and S3. (v) Technologies or measures employed to reduce GHG emissions or air pollutant emissions in different scenarios, as well as their potentials in emission reductions, are generated from extensive industrial surveys and expert interviews (the list of available technologies or measures is available in Supporting Information Table S4). The resulting data set is available from the lead contact on request.
